Runlong Yu

Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science, University of Alabama ryu5@ua.edu

About Me

I am an Assistant Professor in Computer Science at the University of Alabama. Previously, I was a Postdoctoral Associate in Computer Science at the University of Pittsburgh, working under the mentorship of Prof. Xiaowei Jia. I earned my Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) in 2023. Prior to that, I received my B.Eng. in Computer Science from USTC in 2017.

My primary research interest is advancing artificial intelligence and data science to address real-world problems with significant societal and scientific impact. A central theme of my work lies at the intersection of machine learning, environmental and geospatial intelligence, and AI applications in science. I aim to develop modeling and reasoning systems that are grounded in real-world data, informed by domain knowledge, and centered on human decision-making, with applications to complex Earth system challenges. My work has been recognized by major community awards, including the IEEE ICDM Best BlueSky Paper Award (First Prize). To gain a more comprehensive understanding of my background, you can visit my Curriculum Vitae.

Research Areas & Interests

  • AI for Science & Scientific Data Mining: representation learning for spatiotemporal and graph-structured data; self-supervised learning; physics-guided machine learning; physics-informed neural networks (PINNs); neural operators for PDE-constrained physical systems; process-based modeling and scientific data generation.
  • Generative AI & Foundation Models: large language models (LLMs) and multimodal foundation models; diffusion models and flow matching; retrieval-augmented generation (RAG); LLM-based agents; knowledge-grounded reasoning; semantic digital twins for scientific workflows and decision support.
  • GeoAI & Environmental Applications: data assimilation; inverse modeling; multiscale downscaling; heatwave modeling and land surface temperature (LST) reconstruction; satellite and remote sensing data mining; ecosystem and aquatic system modeling; freshwater systems; turbulence and flow simulation; wildfire simulation and other environmental extremes; carbon-neutral and sustainability-oriented modeling.
  • Optimization & Recommender Systems (Earlier Work): evolutionary computation for real-parameter optimization; multi-objective optimization; evolutionary feature selection; recommender systems and collaborative filtering; click-through rate prediction; learning-to-rank and user modeling.
